Look I've never reviewed a movie in my life here in rotten tomatoes but I just left the theatre completely baffled by this movie. 

In this chapter\, the flat humor found in the subversions is more important than meaningful development here.

It's one thing to not answer any questions the previous chapter set up (it doesn't) 

But the real crime is when it tries to double down on the fact that what the audience wants to know from the previous chapter "doesn't matter" or tries to make you feel stupid for caring. 

Say what you want about the prequels... Im right there with you. 

they don't feel anywhere near as lazy.
